Constructor Detail

QCMetrics

Method Detail

getDag

public static List<List<Block>> getDag(List<Block> blockList)
Takes in a list of Blocks; returns a list of lists of Blocks representing all possible paths through the survey. See @etosch's blog post for more detail.

Parameters:
blockList - A list of blocks we would like to traverse.
Returns:
A list of lists of blocks, giving all possible traversals through the original input.

getPaths

protected static List<List<Block>> getPaths(Survey s)
Returns paths through **blocks** in the survey. Top level randomized blocks are all listed last

Parameters:
s - The survey whose paths we want to enumerate
Returns:
A List of all paths through the survey. A path is represented by a List. There may be duplicate paths, so if you need distinct paths, you will need to filter for uniqueness.

makeFrequenciesForPaths

protected static Map<List<Block>,List<SurveyResponse>> makeFrequenciesForPaths(List<List<Block>> paths,
                                                                               List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses)
Returns the counts for each path; see @etosch's blog post on the calculation.

Parameters:
paths - The list of list of blocks through the survey; can be obtained with getPaths or getDag
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey
Returns:
A map from path to the frequency the path is observed.

removeFreetext

protected static List<Question> removeFreetext(List<Question> questionList)

getEquivalentAnswerVariants

protected static List<Component> getEquivalentAnswerVariants(Question q,
                                                             Component c)
Returns equivalent answer options (a list of survey.Component)

Parameters:
q - The question whose variants we want. If there are no variants, then a set of just this question is returned.
c - The answer the respondent provided for this question.
Returns:
A list of the equivalent answers.

surveyEntropy

public static double surveyEntropy(Survey survey,
                                   List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses)
Calculates the empirical entropy for this survey, given a set of responses.

Parameters:
survey - The survey these respondents answered.
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey.
Returns:
The caluclated base-2 entropy.

getQuestions

public static List<Question> getQuestions(List<Block> blockList)
Returns all questions in a block list (typically the topLevelBlocks of a Survey).

Parameters:
blockList - A list of blocks we would like to traverse.
Returns:
A list of questions.

getMaxPossibleEntropy

public static double getMaxPossibleEntropy(Survey survey)
The public method used to compute the maximum number of bits needed to represent this survey.

Parameters:
survey - Input survey whose max entropy we want to compute.
Returns:
The maximum possible entropy for this source.

                                throws SurveyException

makeFrequencies

public static Map<String,Map<String,Integer>> makeFrequencies(List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses)
When used without the survey argument, this returns frequencies that do not calculate smoothing.

Parameters:
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey
Returns:
A map from question ids to maps of option ids to counts.

makeFrequencies

public static Map<String,Map<String,Integer>> makeFrequencies(List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses,
                                                              Survey survey)
Creates a frequency map for the actual responses to the survey. If the survey argument is not null, it will c calculate LaPlace smoothing.

Parameters:
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey.
survey - The survey these respondents answered.
Returns:
A map from question ids to a map of option ids to counts.

makeProbabilities

generateBootstrapSample

public static List<List<SurveyResponse>> generateBootstrapSample(List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses,
                                                                 int iterations)
Generates the bootstrap sample for the input response and the specified number of iterations. Default 2000.

Parameters:
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey.
iterations - The number of bootstrap samples we should generate.
Returns:
The bootstrapped sample of possible survey responses.

                                   throws SurveyException

logLikelihoodClassification

public static boolean logLikelihoodClassification(Survey survey,
                                                  SurveyResponse sr,
                                                  List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses,
                                                  boolean smoothing,
                                                  double alpha)
                                           throws SurveyException
Returns true if the response is valid, on the basis of the log likelihood.

Parameters:
survey - The survey these respondents answered.
sr - The survey response we are classifying.
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey
smoothing - Boolean indicating whether we should smooth our calculation of answer frequencies.
alpha - The cutoff used for determining whether a likelihood is too low (a percentage of area under the curve).
Returns:
Decision indicating whether the input response is valid.
Throws:
SurveyException

entropyClassification

public static boolean entropyClassification(Survey survey,
                                            SurveyResponse sr,
                                            List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses,
                                            boolean smoothing,
                                            double alpha)
                                     throws SurveyException
Return true if the response is valid, on the basis of an entropy-based metric.

Parameters:
survey - The survey these respondents answered.
sr - The survey response we are classifying.
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey
smoothing - Boolean indicating whether we should smooth our calculation of answer frequencies.
alpha - The cutoff used for determining whether a likelihood is too low (a percentage of area under the curve).
Returns:
boolean indicating whether the response is valid.
Throws:
SurveyException

getFrequenciesOfRandomCorrelation

public static Map<Question,Map<Question,CorrelationStruct>> getFrequenciesOfRandomCorrelation(Survey survey,
                                                                                              int sampleSize)
                                                                                       throws SurveyException
Simulates a survey of 100% random uniform respondents over sampleSize and calculates a prior on false correlation.

Parameters:
survey - The survey these respondents answered.
sampleSize - The sample size the survey writer intends to use during the full-scale study.
Returns:
Empirical false correlation.
Throws:
SurveyException

calculateBreakoffByPosition

public static BreakoffByPosition calculateBreakoffByPosition(Survey survey,
                                                             List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses)
Aggregates the breakoff according to the last position answered.

Parameters:
survey - The survey these respondents answered.
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey.
Returns:
A BreakoffByPosition object containing all of the values just computed.

calculateBreakoffByQuestion

public static BreakoffByQuestion calculateBreakoffByQuestion(Survey survey,
                                                             List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses)
Aggregates the breakoff according to which question was last answered.

Parameters:
survey - The survey these respondents answered.
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey.
Returns:
A BreakoffByQuestion object containing all of the values just computed.

calculateWordingBiases

public static WordingBiasStruct calculateWordingBiases(Survey survey,
                                                       List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses,
                                                       double alpha)
                                                throws SurveyException
Searches for significant wording biases observed in survey responses.

Parameters:
survey - The survey these respondents answered.
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey.
alpha - The cutoff used for determining whether the bias is significant.
Returns:
A WordingBiasStruct object containing all of the values just computed.
Throws:
SurveyException

calculateOrderBiases

public static OrderBiasStruct calculateOrderBiases(Survey survey,
                                                   List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses,
                                                   double alpha)
                                            throws SurveyException
Searches for significant order biases observed in survey responses.

Parameters:
survey - The survey these respondents answered.
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey.
alpha - The cutoff used for determining whether the bias is significant.
Returns:
An OrderBiasStruct object containing all of the values just computed.
Throws:
SurveyException

classifyResponses

public static ClassifiedRespondentsStruct classifyResponses(Survey survey,
                                                            List<? extends SurveyResponse> responses,
                                                            Classifier classifier,
                                                            boolean smoothing,
                                                            double alpha)
                                                     throws SurveyException
Classifies the input responses according to the classifier. The DynamicSurveyResponse objects will hold the computed classification, and the method will return a classification structure for easy printing and jsonizing.

Parameters:
survey - The survey these respondents answered.
responses - The list of actual or simulated responses to the survey.
classifier - The enum corresponding to the classifier type.
smoothing - A boolean value indicating whether the frequencies of responses should be smoothed.
alpha - The cutoff used for determining whether validity is exceptionally low.
Returns:
A ClassifiedRespondentsStruct object containing all of the values just computed.
Throws:
SurveyException
